info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Spartanburg and northwestern Union Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Spartanburg, or near Roebuck, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Union, Roebuck, Buffalo, Moore, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs, Jonesville, Cross Keys and Pauline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
